net.minecraft.src
Class BlockMortal

java.lang.Object
  net.minecraft.src.Block
      net.minecraft.src.BlockGrowable
          net.minecraft.src.BlockMortal
All Implemented Interfaces:
BlockDeathInterface, Growable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlockCactus, BlockFlower, BlockReed
public abstract class BlockMortal
extends BlockGrowable
implements BlockDeathInterface

Specifies a block which is mortal and can die (not in the sense of sentient, but the sense of is not forever like most blocks) In this implementation, all blocks that can die can also grow

deathModifierName

protected java.lang.String deathModifierName
Implement this string as your biome modifier to be used by mod_autoforest. Use empty string to skip biome modification

getPrivacyRadius

protected int getPrivacyRadius(net.minecraft.src.World world,
                               int i,
                               int j,
                               int k)
Return's max radii of other nearby plants Do not use a radius above 5, if you want to, overload hasStarved 5 * 5 * 5 = 125, that's a lot of blocks to check Return 0 to skip this check

Parameters:
world -
i -
j -
k -
Returns:
Radius of nearby scan to check in starvation routine
